sen.j: 東寺真言宗（とうじしんごんしゅう）は、日本における真言系仏教宗派のひとつで、古義真言宗に属する。
sen.e: The To-ji Temple Shingon sect is a Buddhism sect in Shingon lineage in Japan and is classified into the Kogi Shingon (Old Shingon) sect.
The To-ji Temple Shingon sect is a Buddhist sect in Japan classified into the Kogi Shingon (Old Shingon) sect.
The To-ji Temple Shingon sect is a Buddhist sect in Japan classified into the Kogi Shingon (Old Shingon) sect.
The Sohonzan (the head temple of a Buddhist sect) is the To-ji Temple.
The Sohonzan (the head temple of a Buddhist sect) is the To-ji Temple.
The Sohonzan (the head temple of a Buddhist sect) is the To-ji Temple.
The founder of the sect is Kukai (Kobodaishi).
The founder of the sect is Kukai (Kobodaishi).
The founder of the sect is Kukai (also known as Kobodaishi).

sen.j: なお、真言宗東寺派とは、異なる宗派である。
sen.e: In addition, it is different from the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect.
It is different from the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect.
It is different from the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect.

History
History
History

sen.j: 東寺真言宗の歴史は、教王護国寺（東寺）の開創に始まる。
sen.e: The history of the To-ji Temple Shingon sect began from the foundation of the Kyougokoku-ji Temple.
The history of the To-ji Temple Shingon sect began from the foundation of the Kyougokoku-ji Temple.
The history of the To-ji Temple Shingon sect began from the foundation of the Kyoogokoku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 823年（弘仁4年）に教王護国寺は嵯峨天皇から空海に下賜され、真言密教の根本道場となった。
sen.e: In 823 the Kyougokoku-ji Temple was given to Kukai from the Emperor Saga, and became the konpon dojo-seminary of Shingon Esoteric Buddhism.
In 823 the Kyougokoku-ji Temple was given to Kukai from the Emperor Saga, and became the konpon dojo-seminary of Shingon Esoteric Buddhism.
In 823 the Kyoogokoku-ji Temple was given to Kukai from the Emperor Saga, and became the konpon dojo-seminary of Shingon Esoteric Buddhism.

sen.j: 以降、江戸時代まで、教王護国寺は真言宗の長者寺としてその役割を果たしてきたが、明治時代に入ると、政府の宗教政策から、真言宗は、古義真言宗・新義真言宗各派が合同することとなった。
sen.e: After that, until the Edo period, the Kyougokoku-ji Temple had played a role of the head temple of the Shingon sect, and in the Meiji period, various schools of the Kogi Shingon sect and the Shingi (new) Shingon sect were integrated in accordance with a religious policy of the government.

After that, until the Edo period, the Kyougokoku-ji Temple had played a role as the head temple of the Shingon sect, and during the Meiji period, various schools of the Kogi Shingon sect and the Shingi (new) Shingon sect were integrated in accordance with the religious policy of the government.

After that, until the Edo period, the Kyoogokoku-ji Temple had played a role as the head temple of the Shingon sect, and during the Meiji period, various schools of the Kogi Shingon sect and the Shingi (new) Shingon sect were integrated in accordance with the religious policy of the government.

sen.j: 管長を古義派（金剛峯寺・教王護国寺）と新義派（智積院・長谷寺）の4寺院から互選することとなり、東寺は管長を選出する四本山の一つとなった。
sen.e: The chief abbot was selected from the four temples of the Kogi school (the Kongobu-ji Temple and the Kyougokoku-ji Temple) and the Shingi school (the Chishaku-in Temple and the Hase-dera Temple), and the To-ji Temple was one of the four head temples which selected a chief abbot.

The chief abbot was selected from the four temples of the Kogi school (the Kongobu-ji Temple and the Kyougokoku-ji Temple) and the Shingi school (the Chishaku-in Temple and the Hase-dera Temple), and the To-ji Temple was one of the four head temples which selected a chief abbot.

The chief abbot was selected from the four temples of the Kogi school (the Kongobu-ji Temple and the Kyoogokoku-ji Temple) and the Shingi school (the Chishaku-in Temple and the Hase-dera Temple), and the To-ji Temple was one of the four head temples which selected a chief abbot.

sen.j: しかし、この状態も長く続かず分裂を繰りかえした。
sen.e: However, this framework did not last long and they split over repeatedly.
However, this framework did not last long and they split repeatedly.
However, this framework did not last long and they split repeatedly.

sen.j: 1901年（明治34年）に教王護国寺は、山階派・小野派・泉涌寺（古義真言宗）とともに連合し、1907年（明治40年）には、真言宗東寺派の派名を公称した。
sen.e: In 1901 the Kyougokoku-ji Temple formed a union with Yamashina school, Ono school and the Sennyu-ji Temple (Kogi Shingon sect) and they began to use the name of the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect in public in 1907.

In 1901 the Kyougokoku-ji Temple formed a union with Yamashina school, Ono school and the Sennyu-ji Temple (Kogi Shingon sect) and they began to use the name of the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect in public in 1907.

In 1901 the Kyoogokoku-ji Temple formed a union with Yamashina school, Ono school and the Sennyu-ji Temple (Kogi Shingon sect) and they began to use the name of the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect in public in 1907.

sen.j: 太平洋戦争にともなう、政府の宗教政策により再び、古義真言宗派と新義真言宗派の合同が図られ、大真言宗に統合させられた。
sen.e: During the Pacific War, the government tried to integrate the Kogi Shingon sect and the Shingi Shingon sect again, and they were integrated into the Daishingon sect.
During the Pacific War, the government tried to integrate the Kogi Shingon sect and the Shingi Shingon sect again, and they were integrated into the Daishingon sect.
During the Pacific War, the government tried to integrate the Kogi Shingon sect and the Shingi Shingon sect again, and they were integrated into the Daishingon sect.

sen.j: 戦後、大真言宗から、1946年（昭和21年）2月に真言宗東寺派と旧称に復して独立した。
sen.e: After the war, it gained independency with using the old name of the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect from the Daishingon sect on February 1946.
After the war, it gained independence, using the old name of the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect, from the Daishingon sect on February 1946.
After the war, it gained independence, using the old name of the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect, from the Daishingon sect on February 1946.

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年）9月3日に宗教法人認証。
sen.e: It got certified as a religious corporation on September 3, 1952.
It became certified as a religious corporation on September 3, 1952.
It became certified as a religious corporation on September 3, 1952.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）に、東寺を中心とした宗派の形態に復帰することを目的に、真言宗東寺派から、東寺真言宗が分派独立することとなった。
sen.e: In 1963 the To-ji Temple Shingon sect separated from the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect and gained independency for the purpose of returning to the framework centered around the To-ji Temple.
In 1963 the To-ji Temple Shingon sect separated from the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect and gained independency for the purpose of returning to the framework centered around the To-ji Temple.
In 1963 the To-ji Temple Shingon sect separated from the To-ji School of the Shingon Sect and gained independency for the purpose of returning to the framework centered around the To-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1974年（昭和49年）10月25日に認証された。
sen.e: It got certified as a religious corporation on October 25, 1974.
It became certified as a religious corporation on October 25, 1974.
It became certified as a religious corporation on October 25, 1974.
